oop.tema3.engine

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • oop.tema3.engine.GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Botarleanu Robert-Mihai 321CB A GameEngine class which will determine the state of all cells in the next generation and update the current one.

    • Method Detail

      • createCellArray

        private Cell[][] createCellArray(int n)
        Creates a cell array of the given size. Used for the cells array for the following generation.
        Parameters:
        n - size of cell array
        Returns:
        a cell array of the gien nxn size.

      • resolveCellSurvival

        public void resolveCellSurvival(Cell[][] cells)
        Determines the state of each cell in the following generation. For Cells that are on the border of the array, the strategy set in the configuration object is used.
        Parameters:
        cells - array of cells that describes the current state of the game.

      • onBorder

        private boolean onBorder(int i,
               int j,
               Cell[][] cells)
        Determines if a cell is on the border of the array.
        Parameters:
        i - the line position of a Cell in the array.
        j - the column position of a Cell in the array.
        cells - the array of cells that describes the current state of the game
        Returns:
        true if the cell is on the border of the array.

      • resolveSurvival

        private void resolveSurvival(Cell[][] cells,
                   Cell[][] nextGeneration,
                   int i,
                   int j)
        Parameters:
        cells - an array that describes the current state of the game.
        nextGeneration - an array that describes the state of the game in the following generation.
        i - line coordinate of a cell.
        j - column coordinate of a cell.

      • countNeighbours

        private int countNeighbours(Cell[][] cells,
                  int i,
                  int j)
        Determines the number of alive neighbours a cell has. The cell will not be on the border of the array.
        Parameters:
        cells - the Cell array that describes the current state of the game.
        i - line coordinate of the cell.
        j - column coordinate of the cell.
        Returns:
        the number of alive neighbours of a cell.
